data.title: Sydney Pollack Biography
data.meta_description: Read all about Sydney Pollack with TV Guide's exclusive biography including their list of awards, celeb facts and more at TV Guide.
data.text:
Fast Facts

Studied acting from 1953 to '54 at New York City's famed Neighborhood Playhouse with legendary teacher Sanford Meisner, and then taught there himself from 1954 to '59

Once studied dance with Martha Graham

Directed more than 80 TV episodes, including Ben Casey, Alfred Hitchcock Presents, The Fugitive and The Defenders

Played the role of Dustin Hoffman's agent in Tootsie (1982) at the urging of the star

His 2005 political thriller The Interpreter was the first motion picture ever allowed to film inside the United Nations building in New York City
